13183.「……ああ。よ……やく 応えて……らえた。: Ah.... Fi... ally... Someone answ...d me.

13184.「シーバの鏡とは……２枚ひと組で\n 遠く……はなれた相手と……会話できる\n:
The Sheba mirror is... A pair of mirrors that
..Lets you…Talk to someone far....Far away...
It's a magical... Mirror.

13185.「あなたは……<pc>さんで…すか。\n レベル３０以上の……魔法使いの方と\n:
Are you...<pc>? I see that you
are a mage... of level 30 or above.

13186.「え…え。この鏡は……それなりの魔力を\n 持った者に……しか 使えな…いのです:
Y...Yes. This mirror... can only be used by
those who possess a certain amount of
magical power.

13187.「ところで……私は ウェ…ナ諸島に\n いるのですが……あなたは ど…こで\n:
By the way... I'm in the Wena Islands.
Where.... are you hearing...
my voice from?

13188.「……ほほ…う。港町レンドアの…宿屋で…すか。\n それは すば……らしい！:
...Ah, I see...you are... at the Port Town of
Lendor? That's... most wonderful!

13189.「港町レンドアと…いうことは 鉄道を使えば\n オ……グリード大…陸の ゲルト海:
Port Town Lendor... which means... a short
train ride to the Gert Strait... on the
Ogreed... continent... correct?

13190.「知りあった…ばかりの あな…たに\n こんなこと頼む…のも 気が引けますが\n:
Even though... we've just met...
I'm sorry to ask... but there's a
favor I'd... like to ask of you.

13191.「じつは その ゲルト海峡に出現す…る\n <%sEV_QUE_NAME0>に:
While in the Gert Strait... use Bang to kill
the Clockwork Cuckoo that appears. Once
defeated, it will drop a Magic Stone.

13192.「その 魔導の石を 手に入れて……\n もう一度 こ…の鏡に 話しかけて……\n:
Once you obtain the Magic Stone.. Can you
talk to the mirror... once more... and give
the stone... to me?

13193.「おお。ありがとうござ…います。\n あなたは すばらし……人だ！:
Oh, thank you so much. You are a wonderful
person!

13194.「くれぐれも よろし……くお願いします。\n それでは 今日のとこ…ろは \n:
Please do not hesitate to... contact me.
For today... I leave you with this.

13195.「おお。ありがとうござ…います。\n で…も あなたは たく…さんの\n 頼まれ:
Thank you very much... but you are
carrying too many requests... from others...
who are in... need of help.

13196.「しかた……ありませんね。\n この件は また今度……ということで。:
There is no other... choice. We'll talk
about this... another time.

13197.「そ…うですか。残念……です。\n もし 気が変わ……たら また\n この鏡に:
I see... that's too bad... if you change
your mind... please talk... to the mirror
again.

13337.「そ…れでは その魔導の石を\n 鏡に向か……て かかげて…ください。\n こ…:
Now then... please hold up the Magic Stone...
in front... of the mirror. This mirror...
has a wonderful ability... you see.

13338.「なんと 鏡自体の大き…さを超えな…モノなら\n 鏡を通し…て 相手側に 送るこ:
If the object is not larger... than the size
of the mirror itself... it can be sent to
the other side.. that's what it's capable of!

13339.魔導の石は 光に変わって\n鏡の中に 吸い込まれていった！:
The Magic Stone was turned into light and
sucked into the mirror!

13340.「ちゃん…と 届きまし…たよ。\n それでは こちらか……も 今回のお礼……\n:
It... has arrived.. let me thank you...
properly with... a token of my...
appreciation!

13341.「本当……あり……とうござい……た。\n あな……が 親切な……で……かったです:
Thank you... very much... you were very...
kind... and helpful.

13342.「あ…れ？ ……を送っ……ら\n 急に……声……れなくな…………したね。:
Oh... huh?... your voice... suddenly...
stopped.

13343.「こ……鏡は……古……から……調子が……。\n これ以……会話……には……。:
This mirror... has been... in bad shape
... for a while... after this...
conversation...

13344.「……うですね。時が……たら……\n 試し……しょう。……まで\n 鏡の直しか…:
...Well, when the time... comes... we'll
try... it out... until then... take care of...
fixing... the... mirror...

13345.「もしか……して 私の お願い…を\n 引き受けてく…れる気に なりました…か？:
Are you... ready... to... accept... my...
request?

26234.「私は……魔法使い…リュナン。\n たまたま この…シーバの鏡を手に入れ……\n:
I am Lunan... the mage. By chance, I found
this... mirror of Sheba... and I'm speaking
to you... from beyond this mirror.
